general

Class Utils

  • java.lang.Object
    • general.Utils

  • public class Utils
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds static methods which are used in multiple places.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static char[] ALPHABET
      Contains every capital letter in the English alphabet in order.

      • ALPHABET

        public static final char[] ALPHABET

    • Constructor Detail

      • Utils

        public Utils()

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public static int[] add(int[] a,
                        int[] b)
        Adds each element in a to each element in b into a third array of the same size.
        This is most useful for adding vectors to calculate positions on a Board.
        Parameters:
        a - The first array to add.
        b - The second array to add.
        Returns:
        A new array where the element at each index is the sum of the element at that index in a and b.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a and b are not the same lengths.

      • append

        public static int[] append(int[] a,
                           int[] b)
        Appends b to the end of a.
        Parameters:
        a - The first array.
        b - The second array.
        Returns:
        A new array containing each element of a in order followed by each element of b in order.

      • split

        public static java.util.List<int[]> split(int[] a)
        Splits an array of any length into a list of arrays of length 2.
        Parameters:
        a - The array to split.
        Returns:
        A list of arrays of length 2, containing the elements of a in the same order. If a has an odd number of elements an extra 0 will be added to the end.

      • containsArray

        public static boolean containsArray(java.util.List<int[]> list,
                                    int[] arr)
        Checks if a list contains an array using Arrays.equals(int[], int[]).
        Parameters:
        list - The list to check.
        arr - The array to search for.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the arr was found in list.

      • average

        public static int[] average(int[] a,
                            int[] b)
        Computes the average of each element of a and b into a new array of the same size.
        If the arrays represent points, this can be used to find the midpoint between them.
        Parameters:
        a - The first array.
        b - The second array.
        Returns:
        A new array where the element at each index is the average of the element at that index in a and b.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a and b are not the same lengths.

      • seqAverage

        public static java.util.List<int[]> seqAverage(java.util.List<int[]> list)
        Computes the average between each pair of consecutive arrays in list using average(int[], int[]).
        Parameters:
        list - The list of arrays.
        Returns:
        A new list containing the averages between each pair of consecutive arrays in list.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if all of the arrays in list are not the same length.

      • parseCoords

        public static int[] parseCoords(java.lang.String s)
        Converts a series of Chess coordinates into indexes for an array.
        Chess coordinates consist of a letter representing a column number followed by the row number, where A1 is the top left corner.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to parse.
        Returns:
        An array of coordinates: {row, column, row, column,...}

      • parseCoord

        public static int[] parseCoord(java.lang.String s)
        Converts a single Chess coordinate into indexes for an array.
        Chess coordinates consist of a letter representing a column number followed by the row number, where A1 is the top left corner.
        Parameters:
        s - The String to parse.
        Returns:
        An array with the row and column the Chess coordinates represent.

      • scale

        public static javax.swing.ImageIcon scale(javax.swing.ImageIcon original,
                                          int width,
                                          int height)
        Scales an ImageIcon.
        Parameters:
        original - The icon to scale.
        width - The width to scale to.
        height - The height to scale to.
        Returns:
        A new ImageIcon with the specified dimensions, or the original ImageIcon if either width or height is 0.
